title: Chiricahua National Monument: Weather
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information     Weather              Weather       Chiricahua National Monument ranges from 5,124 feet / 1,562 meters  in elevation at the entrance station to 7,310 feet / 2,228 meters at the summit of Sugarloaf Mountain. You can enjoy the differences of four seasons. Check the weather chart for monthly average temperatures and precipitation to help plan your visit.  See current conditions similar to those found at the visitor center, or check the weather forecast for higher elevations like those at the end of the scenic drive. Coordinates for the park: 32.01°N 109.33°W (Elev. 6932 ft)      New! Weather Stations at Chiricahua National Monument Check our weather stations around the park in real time.
